text: The 2019 Italian Athletics Championships was the 109th edition of the Italian Athletics Championships and took place in Brixen from 26 to 28 July. ==Champions== {| class="wikitable" width=70% style="font-size:90%; text- align:center;" |-bgcolor=moccasin |align=center colspan=5|Track events |- !Event !!Men !!Performance !!Women !!Performance |- |100 m |align=left|Marcell Jacobs ||10.10 |align=left| ||11.47 |- |200 m |align=left|Antonio Infantino || 20.84 |align=left|Gloria Hooper || 23.56 |- |400 m |align=left|Matteo Galvan ||45.59 |align=left|Giancarla Trevisan ||52.61 |- |800 m |align=left|Simone Barontini || 1:47.89 |align=left| || 2:05.83 |- |1500 m |align=left|Matteo Spanu || 3:45.09 |align=left|Marta Zenoni || 4:30.83 |- |5000 m |align=left|Marouan Razine || 14:05.09 |align=left|Marta Zenoni || 15:52.89 |- |110/100 m hs |align=left|Hassane Fofana || 13.71 |align=left|Luminosa Bogliolo || 12.85 |- |400 m hs |align=left|Alessandro Sibilio || 50.84 |align=left|Ayomide Folorunso || 56.40 |- |3000 m st |align=left|Ahmed Abdelwahed || 8:31.56 |align=left|Isabel Mattuzzi || 10:10.66 |- |4x100 m relay |align=left|Athletic Club 96 Alperia Jacques Riparelli Antonio Infantino Alessandro Monte Kevin Giacomelli || 40.92 |align=left|Atletica Brescia 1950 Ispa Group Chiara Melon Gaia Pedreschi Alessia Niotta Johanelis Herrera Abreu || 45.63 |- |4x400 m relay |align=left|G.S. Fiamme Gialle Vladimir Aceti Michele Tricca Alessandro Sibilio Matteo Galvan || 3:11.15 |bgcolor=lightgrey align=center colspan=2| Not yet awardedDue to technical reasons, it was impossible to run 2 of the 3 heats. The winner of the only heat run was G.S. Fiamme Gialle. The event has been rerun at Rovereto, on 27 August 2019: Atletica Sandro Calvesi won the final with, SERGI Sofia - PIRANA Veronica - FOUDRAZ Eleonora - MARCHIANDO Eleonora, 3:48.35 |- |-bgcolor=plum |align=center colspan=5|Road events |- |10 km walk (road) |align=left|Gianluca Picchiottino || 21.21 |align=left|Eleonora Giorgi || 45:28 |-bgcolor=lightgreen |align=center colspan=5|Field events |- |Long jump |align=left|Filippo Randazzo || 7.94 m |align=left|Tania Vicenzino || 6.46 m |- |Triple jump |align=left|Samuele Cerro || 16.52 m |align=left|Ottavia Cestonaro || 13.52 m |- |High jump |align=left|Stefano Sottile || 2.33 m |align=left|Alessia Trost || 1.86 m |- |Pole vault |align=left|Max Mandusic || 5.30 m |align=left|Sonia Malavisi || 4.36 m |- |Shot put |align=left|Leonardo Fabbri || 20.31 m |align=left|Chiara Rosa || 16.10 m |- |Discus throw |align=left|Giovanni Faloci || 59.92 m |align=left|Stefania Strumillo || 57.33 m |- |Hammer throw |align=left|Marco Lingua || 73,88 m |align=left|Sara Fantini || 69.75 m |- |Javelin throw |align=left|Mauro Fraresso || 75.54 m |align=left|Carolina Visca || 58.47 m |- |-bgcolor=khaki |align=center colspan=5|Combined |- |Decathlon/Heptathlon |align=left|Matteo Taviani || 7357 pts |align=left|Sveva Gerevini || 5907 pts |} {| class="wikitable" width=70% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |-bgcolor=moccasin |align=center colspan=5|Road events in Canelli, 8 September |- !Event !!Men !!Performance !!Women !!Performance |- |10 km |align=left|Lorenzo Dini || |align=left|Fatna Maraoui || |- |} ==References== ==See also== *2019 Italian Athletics Indoor Championships ==External links== * All results at FIDAL web site Italian Athletics Championships Athletics Category:Italian Athletics Outdoor Championships Category:Athletics competitions in Italy
